column3: Early career: individual depth, low ambiguity. Impact is limited to their own work, contributing to team outcomes through well-scoped tasks. Able to execute small-scope work and operates mostly independently with minimal oversight and support to clarify problems and decisions.
column4: Experienced: team depth, moderate ambiguity. Impact expands to their immediate team, improving clarity, quality, and decision-making. Operates independently without oversight or with minimal support (in complex problem spaces), using sound judgement to drive outcomes.
column5: Emerging leader: vertical breadth, high ambiguity. Impact spans an entire vertical, influencing multiple teams and elevating quality and systems. Operates with high autonomy and brings agency, guiding teams and unblocking others without managerial direction.
column6: Leader: cross-vertical influence, very high ambiguity. Impact reaches across verticals, aligning teams and driving coherence at scale. Operates as a design leader, initiating and leading change across verticals.
column7: Seasoned leader: company-wide influence, maximum ambiguity. Impact spans the full design org and company, influencing strategy, standards, and culture. Operates as a transformational leader, able to transform org-wide design direction, design standards, and culture; sets the design vision and defines Deel Design craft.

column3: Aligns their work with the broader strategy and understands how customer needs and business goals shape design direction. Connects day-to-day design decisions to strategic intent by articulating how their work supports user needs and business goals. Brings fresh perspectives to their own work by exploring multiple approaches and questioning obvious or default solutions.
column4: Influences team strategy by clarifying the problem space, reframing challenges, and using insights to guide which problems the team prioritises. Strengthens team understanding of strategy by translating insights into clear problem framing and helping the team stay focused on the most meaningful opportunities. Reframes problems to introduce fresh perspectives and challenge conventional ways of thinking within the team.
column5: Influences the strategy of a vertical by defining the design direction and establishing the strategic approach for that area. Shapes strategic conversations within the vertical by using insights, narratives, design vision and experience principles to influence direction and uncover new opportunity spaces. Unlocks new opportunities by reframing complex problem spaces and imagining alternative models, workflows, or experiences.
column6: Co-creates strategy for one or several verticals by shaping design direction, design vision, and long-term experience vision across domains. Drives strategic alignment across verticals by articulating cross-domain insights, challenging assumptions, and framing experience vision in collaboration with Directors. Identifies cross-vertical opportunity spaces and establishes new patterns of thinking that teams can adopt broadly.
column7: Defines the company-wide experience vision and ensures design meaningfully influences long-term business strategy. Shapes organisational priorities through customer insight, storytelling, and a compelling design-led narrative. Redefines how innovation happens at Deel Design, setting new paradigms for problem framing and creative thinking.

column3: Applies craft standards by following established patterns, guidelines, and systems across interaction, visual design, and accessibility. Delivers clear, detailed, production-ready work and strengthens their core craft skills through consistent execution.
column4: Demonstrates mastery and elevates craft standards in practice, raises the quality of execution within the team. Improves consistency & quality through critique, feedback, and hands-on examples of high-quality work. Balances speed and quality, knowing when to polish and when to ship to learn.
column5: Codifies craft standards for a vertical by formalising patterns, quality expectations, and reusable approaches that emerge from practice. Ensures coherence across the vertical, reducing fragmentation and inconsistencies between teams. Turns implicit good design into explicit guidelines, principles, and reusable approaches that teams can follow consistently. Mentors designers to help them consistently apply high-quality craft.
column6: Co-defines craft philosophy and standards across Deel Design, setting a clear bar for quality and consistency. Contributes to Design-wide decisions about quality and craft direction, in collaboration with Directors & Principal Designers. Ensures coherence across verticals by reviewing work, identifying systemic gaps, and addressing fragmentation in experience quality. Establishes and maintains craft governance, deciding when standards should be extended or challenged. Represents Deel's craft internally and externally, acting as a trusted voice for design quality and standards across the company.
column7: Envisions the long-term craft direction for Deel Design, setting future-facing standards and shaping Deel's design identity. Defines craft standards, how it is practiced and experienced at scale, elevating quality across the organisation and modelling excellence. Shapes organisational thinking about craft, influencing leadership decisions, hiring, and investment through a strong point of view on quality. Sets the bar for design excellence at an industry level, representing Deel as a recognised craft leader and influencing how design is practiced beyond the company.

column3: Communicates clearly within their immediate team, both verbally and in writing, articulating design decisions with clear intent and rationale. May require support or preparation to communicate effectively in more complex or high-stakes contexts.
column4: Clearly explains design decisions and trade-offs, supporting shared understanding across Product, Engineering, and adjacent functions (e.g. PMM, Brand). Uses storytelling, critique, and workshops to help the team align and move forward.
column5: Influences alignment across a vertical through clear narrative and communication. Manages stakeholders across teams with minimal oversight. Coaches designers on communication and stakeholder management.
column6: Aligns senior stakeholders and resolves conflict in complex contexts through compelling narrative and structured communication. Shapes how alignment is achieved at scale across verticals.
column7: Aligns executives through compelling storytelling and clear points of view. Communicates with authority in high-stakes, high-ambiguity contexts. Elevates the communication bar across Deel Design. Represents Deel Design internally and externally as a trusted voice and leader.

column3: Collaborates with other designers in their vertical, participating in critiques and working sessions with openness. Seeks and provides feedback constructively within their immediate team.
column4: Facilitates collaboration within XFN team, helping discussions stay focused and productive. Builds shared understanding across Product, Engineering, and adjacent functions. Proactively seeks and provides feedback to strengthen team outcomes.
column5: Drives effective cross-team collaboration within a vertical, fostering alignment and shared ownership. Establishes norms for how designers and cross-functional partners work together.
column6: Orchestrates collaboration across verticals. Shapes how collaboration happens at scale, building systems and practices that enable effective cross-team partnership.
column7: Sets the standard for collaboration across Deel Design and cross-functionally. Creates the structures and culture that enable seamless partnership across teams, functions, and geographies.

column3: Delivers assigned tasks reliably, meeting expectations for quality and timelines. Takes responsibility for their own work and follows through on feedback. Proactively flags blockers, risks, or issues as they arise and seeks guidance when needed.
column4: Owns projects end-to-end, from problem understanding through delivery and iteration. Identifies challenges and opportunities within their scope and raises them proactively. Manages dependencies and coordinates with partners to keep work moving. Takes responsibility for outcomes post-launch and learns from impact.
column5: Leads problem spaces within a vertical, setting direction and defining success. Anticipates challenges and opportunities ahead of time, creating clarity before issues materialise. Makes prioritisation and trade-off decisions that unblock teams and maintain momentum. Takes accountability for progress and outcomes across teams.
column6: Steers initiatives across multiple verticals, aligning teams around shared outcomes. Identifies systemic challenges and opportunities, addressing root causes rather than symptoms. Makes high-judgement calls in ambiguous situations, balancing speed, quality, and impact. Takes accountability for long-running, high-stakes initiatives and their downstream effects.
column7: Drives company-level outcomes related to experience and customer impact. Anticipates long-term risks and opportunities, shaping direction before problems surface. Sets the standard for ownership, accountability, and agency across the organisation. Owns the long-term consequences of decisions, ensuring the organisation learns and adapts over time.

column3: Aligns with Deel values and applies them consistently in day-to-day work. Contributes to their direct design team culture, participating in team rituals, critiques, and shared practices. Demonstrates curiosity and openness by experimenting with ideas, inspiration, and tools (including AI) to improve quality and thinking.
column4: Reinforces Deel values consistently through decisions and collaboration. Strengthens team culture, actively helping to shape, maintain and evolve rituals, norms, and ways of working. Applies new tools or technologies where they meaningfully improve how the team works or what it can deliver.
column5: Shapes Design Org culture within a vertical, driving initiatives that improve how designers work and grow. Identifies cultural gaps across teams in the vertical and leads efforts to address them. Invests time in coaching and supporting designers across the vertical. Turns successful experiments into repeatable approaches that others can build on.
column6: Evolves Design Org culture across domains, adapting it as the organisation scales and changes. Sets the benchmark for how Deel values are lived within the design function. Influences the cultural tone of the organisation. Creates conditions where teams can safely explore, test bold ideas, and learn quickly.
column7: Defines the long-term Design Org culture alongside with Design Leaders. Influences the evolution of Deel values through design leadership, organisational impact, and visible role-modelling. Embeds culture into hiring, progression, recognition, and leadership expectations across Deel Design. Builds a culture where experimentation, learning, and reimagining the possible are core to how design operates, inside Deel and beyond.
